result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:27 PM Defendant Savannah A. Mohrland not in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Savannah A. Mohrland.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Pfeil calls the case and states appearances.
Due to non-appearance of the defendant, ADA Pfeil requests a warrant.
Court notes there was notice given.

BY THE COURT:
Bench warrant authorized.
$1000 cash alternative.
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Follow all open bonds

1:09 PM Defendant Savannah A. Mohrland appeared by video from the Portage County Jail.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Savannah A. Mohrland.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard: 20CF249, 21CT178, 22CF60.
Atty Cassidy calls the cases and states the appearances. 

BY THE COURT: Based on defendant's appearance, outstanding warrants are quashed. 

Court questions Atty Renc and the reason for missed court appearances. 
Atty Renc responds. 
Court reviews the files. 

State is requesting bonds be reinstated for cases 20CF249 and 21CT178.
State is requesting that the bond be amended to $750 cash for case 22CF60.
State states reasons as stated on record as reviewing the files. 

Atty Renc is objecting to the cash bond and requests a signature a bond for reasons stated on record. 
Court reviews the files further. 

Ms. Mohrland has received a copy of the criminal complaint for 22CF60.
Court goes over the maximum penalties and charges for this case. 
Defendant waives reading of the criminal complaint. 

BY THE COURT: 
$2,500 signature bond ordered. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Follow all open bonds 
Bonds in other 2 files reinstated

Preliminary Hearing set on 22CF60 for October 17, 2022 @ 3:00 p.m.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 20CF249 & 21CT178 for October 17, 2022 @ 3:00 p.m. to Track with 22CF60
Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  (not mailed)

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge  appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty)  Max Bergner appears in court for defendant. 

22GF51 and 22GF52 are co-defendants, same probable cause in both cases. 

1:36 PM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of possession with intent to deliver and possession of meth and bailjumping. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court finds Court has jurisdiction.
Court recites facts, for the record.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Public defender's office will appoint someone for Defendant.

State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for: March 7, 2022   @ 2:30  p.m.  in Branch 1
